title: Sauerkraut Sausage Casserole
directions: Cut the cabbage in quarters, remove and discard the core. Slice the cabbage, onion, green pepper and mince the garlic. Grease a large saucepan or a Dutch oven with ghee. Add the sliced onion, sausages and cook for 5-8 minutes, until lightly browned. Remove sausages and set aside.
Then add the sliced peppers and cook for a minute. Add the shredded cabbage, ...
Sauerkraut, lemon juice, water, oregano and mix until combined. Cover with a lid and cook over a medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400 F. Transfer the sausages, cover with a lid or a baking foil and place in the oven. Bake for about 60 minutes, and then, remove the foil and bake for another 5 minutes.

Remove from the oven and let it cool down for 5 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with homemade keto Dijon mustard or ketchup. To store, refrigerate for up to 4 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
ingredients: ¼ cup ghee or lard (55 g/ 1.9 oz)
1 medium white or yellow onion, sliced (110 g/ 3.9 oz)
2 cups sauerkraut, drained (284 g/ 10 oz) - you can make your own
1 tbsp freshly chopped oregano or 1 tsp dried oregano
Optional: serve with homemade condiments such as Dijon mustard or ketchup.
